A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Star Wars:  The Last Jedi\, was a visually astounding film.  When I think Star Wars\, I think mind blowing special effects and boy did this movie deliver.  If I'd never seen another Star Wars film\, and saw this as a stand alone film I'd have easily given this a 5 star rating.\n\nHowever\, it is NOT a stand alone film\, it is part of a vast series of films all interconnected to one another.  With characters that are ingrained in pop culture history\, who have become legends in their own right.  And this movie kicks those characters in the face\, and kicks the fans in the face.  I was mortified as I watched them tear down everything we knew and loved about Star Wars\, and replaced it with poorly timed Disney humor.  And adorable marketing ploys disguised an an alien race.  I left the theater confused\, angry\, but still entertained by the visual spectacle I had just seen.  This is not how I ever want to leave a Star Wars film...ever...
